Why can't we just say Optimus started a minor religion that was mostly 
stamped out? We could say everyone else on his team was against it. He 
was never in this game was he?

--- In nbwrpg@y..., wingedwarrior41@h... wrote:
> OOC: I'm afraid this won't work because the Cybertron used before 
was 
> heavily populated. The story you tell me about implies that only a 
few 
> bots were left, but this contradicts what has happened on cybertron. 
> However, I guess nothing holds you from using the story on another 
> world, with some minor changes. There is a bot owned by Lord of 
> Darkness (wonder where he is now) named Cheetor, and a X-Predacon 
> named Black Arachnia.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., dewboy30816@y... wrote:
> > O.k. and Optimus was quickly arrested after discovering the orocal 
> and 
> > everyone thought that was that, but a few of his followers 
survived? 
> > He never fought a second war or rescued any sparks, and barely had 
> > time to find out about organic core and its superiority to water?
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., wingedwarrior41@h... wrote:
> > > OOC: Sorry Dewboy. I know you want this plot to work, but It 
just 
> > > can't. It's just like saying Mustex knows about Veratis when 
they 
> > have 
> > > not actually met in the RPG. The basic story of a rebelling 
> faction 
> > > sending a member to Earth was good, but you can not say 
> > > Techno-organics were on cybertron because it is not the 
Cybertron 
> > that 
> > > has been going on. Beast Machines never happened. This means 
that 
> > the 
> > > Maximals safely arrived on Cybertron, took Megatron to a trial 
or 
> > > something, and, in some way, he went back to Earth. That's it. 
BM 
> > > never happened because if it did, Megatron never could have had 
> went 
> > > back to Earth, he would have been a part of Cybertron. It's 
hard, 
> > but 
> > > you'll have to deal with it.
